thread.title: Sting: The Greatest Musical Privilege Of Being A Bass Player [News]
thread.title_full: Sting: The Greatest Musical Privilege Of Being A Bass Player [News]

title: Sting: The Greatest Musical Privilege Of Being A Bass Player [News]
text:
Sting recently discussed musical privileges of bassists, telling Bass Player Magazine : 
"I always say, 'It's not a C chord until I play a C.'"You can change harmony very subtly but very effectively as a bass player. That's one of the great privileges of your role and that's why I love playing bass. 
"I enjoy the sound of it, I enjoy its harmonic power - it's a lot of subtle heroism; it's not the lead guitar part of playing lots of hemidemisemiquavers [aka 64th notes] to the bar." 
The musician concluded: "It's basically solid workman-like effort."
